sense.name: an event, a public sale done by bidding
sense.commentary: AUCTION[+event][+social][+public][+sale] Note: Refers to specific sales event, not the generic bidding activity. (Sense 3)
sense.examples: Mary took John to an art auction in New York. Their firm buys government notes at the monthly auction of the Treasury Department. They passed around dessert and champagne during the silent auction.

sense.name: a card game in which players bid suits
sense.examples: Sally is teaching us to play auction Bridge.

sense.name: a bidding process
sense.commentary: AUCTION[+activity][+purchasing][+bidding] Note: refers to the bidding act in general, not a specific sales event (sense 1)
sense.examples: These paintings will be sold by auction. (the process of bidding) They have put their house up for auction.
